metadata.title: USN-4882-1 -- Ruby vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Ruby JSON gem incorrectly handled certain JSON files. If a user or automated system were tricked into parsing a specially crafted JSON file, a remote attacker could use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-10663)  It was discovered that Ruby incorrectly handled certain socket memory operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-10933)  It was discovered that Ruby incorrectly handled certain transfer-encoding headers when using Webrick. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass a reverse proxy. (CVE-2020-25613)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4882-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8 ruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8 ruby2.5-doc - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8 ruby2.5-dev - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8 No subscription required
